2 dead, 29 injured at US embassy protest in Tunis

Violent protests outside the US embassy in Tunis were met with tear gas and gunshots Friday, sending waves of black smoke wafting over the city. (AP, 2:29 p.m.)
  • Embassies targeted  |  Afghans protest
  • Probation department looking at filmmaker
  • Pope appeals for peace | Pictures Protests spread

Obama honors return of Libya victims

President Obama today called Ambassador Chris Stevens and three others killed in Libya patriots who served US ideals. (AP, 3:29 p.m.)
  • Libya victim was Winchester native  |  video The Big Story

Lawyers: Chemist at closed state lab tampered with evidence bags

Annie Dookhan allegedly ignored safeguards designed to ensure fair trials in drug cases and tampered with evidence, a lawyers group said. (Globe, 3:02 p.m.)

Romney: 'Middle-income' is $200K to $250K and less

Mitt Romney says he'll reduce taxes on middle-income Americans, which he defines as $200,000 to $250,000 a year and less. (AP, 1:15 p.m.)

  • Pictures Obama and Romney on the campaign trail

Officials: Worcester-area cocaine ring suspects hid drugs in can of beans

Fifteen people were arrested after Operation Devil’s Handshake uncovered a cocaine ring that brought in drugs from Puerto Rico, prosecutors said. (Globe, 2:32 p.m.)

Britain's Pigeon Fanciers

Aficionados still train, keep, and race pigeons for sport. This year, the 40th annual British Homing World Show of the Year, held in Blackpool, had 2,500 pigeon entries from around the world.
